diagnosis.final_diagnosis: Acute Pancreatitis, Biliary obstruction due to ampullary stenosis, Acute renal failure (resolved)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: Patient presented with vomiting, nausea, epigastric abdominal pain, elevated LFTs, and biliary dilatation observed via RUQ ultrasound. MRCP findings indicated a dilated common bile duct and an edematous pancreas, consistent with acute pancreatitis and biliary obstruction due to ampullary stenosis.
